description.narrative: Project Objective: Enhance the capacity of Civil Rights Defenders and Defend Defenders in their respective work across the Sub-Saharan Africa region to protect, support and equip Human Rights Defenders (HRDs) to enable their continued work to increase respect for human rights.

Stöd till Civil Rights Defenders för åtta månaders verksamhet i Östafrika, i första hand kapacitetsutvecklande aktiviteter med DefendDefenders, en regional MR-försvararorganisation med säte i Kampala. Civil Rights Defenders kommer att arbeta tillsammans med DefendDefenders för att stärka kapacitet inom jämställdhet, strategisk kommunikation, säkerhet och finansiell administration. Därutöver syftar insatsen till att stärka CRD:s utökade närvaro och verksamhet i regionen.

Support to Civil Rights Defenders for eight months of interventions in East Africa, in particular with focus on capacity development activities with DefendDefenders, a regional human rights defenders organisation with HQ in Kampala. Civil Rights Defenders will together with DefendDefenders work to strengthen their respective capacity within the areas of gender equality, strategic communication, security, and financial administration. In addition, the contribution aims to support CRD's presence and expanded work in the region.

tag.narrative: 10.2 - By 2030, empower and promote the social, economic and political inclusion of all, irrespective of age, sex, disability, race, ethnicity, origin, religion or economic or other status.

10.2 - Till 2030 möjliggöra och verka för att alla människors, oavsett ålder, kön, funktionsnedsättning, ras, etnicitet, ursprung, religion eller ekonomisk eller annan ställning, blir inkluderade i det sociala, ekonomiska och politiska livet.

10.3 - Ensure equal opportunity and reduce inequalities of outcome, including by eliminating discriminatory laws, policies and practices and promoting appropriate legislation, policies and action in this regard.

10.3 - Säkerställa lika möjligheter och minska förekomsten av ojämlika utfall, bland annat genom att avskaffa diskriminerande lagstiftning, politik och praxis och främja lagstiftning, politik och åtgärder av lämpligt slag i detta hänseende.
16.b - Promote and enforce non-discriminatory laws and policies for sustainable development.
16.b - Verka för och genomdriva icke-diskriminerande lagstiftning och politik för en hållbar utveckling.
5.c - Adopt and strengthen sound policies and enforceable legislation for the promotion of gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls at all levels.
5.c - Anta och stärka välgrundad politik och genomförbar lagstiftning för att främja jämställdhet och öka alla kvinnors och flickors egenmakt på alla nivåer

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: This was a short (10 months) capacity-development project, implemented in collaboration between Civil Rights Defenders, Sweden, and DefendDefenders, Uganda. The two organisations had selected four areas for improvement and there were also bridging funding for CRD's presence in the region. According to the report the capacity of both organisations have been significantly strengthened. 1. Gender equality The specific objective was to increase emergency assistance granting to Women HRDs and to make tailored emergency support more efficient. A consultant provided an analysis of how this could be achieved and the organisations have acted upon the recommendations. Emergency granting to Women HRDs has increased and gendered indicators are established. Concrete increase in women beneficiaries is also reported. 2. Communication Given that the work on communication aimed at strengthening capacity with a long-term perspective, it is too early to assess outcomes. The activities included a joint campaign on Women Human Rights Defenders which was conducted successfully. 3. Security Networks Management and Development Joint work on digital security for HRDs has been strengthened. Two coalitions for HRD (Uganda and Kenya) were connected to the Defenders Database. The work will be followed-up with ToT trainings across the region. 4. Financial and Administrative Management and Sustainability The results achieved were first and foremost associated with Defend Defenders and the quality and effectiveness of their financial and administrative systems. Particular focus was put on the management of grants. In addition, support was provided (first and foremost staff time) to expand and organise presence in Addis Ababa with the intention to better link up to the Ethiopian Human Rights Defenders community, to interact with regional Addis-based bodies, and as part of CRD's more general expansion on the African continent. This short-term project implemented jointly by a Swedish and a regional HRD organisation was a fruitful and appreciated opportunity for them to focus on shared areas of improvement. The report reflects that the work continues within the framework of their joint participation in the Civicus program and under other programs set-ups.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
